item.Name: Is Motion Tracked (By Enemies) When Active
One-Shot Activation Effect#Effect kills itself rather than being explicitly killed when the ability deactivates
Can be activated when weapon state is relaxed
Does Not Appear In Extended Motion Tracker Range

_field_real_fraction.name: activation energy cost#amount of energy required to activate the ability

_field_real.name: active energy consumption:energy/second#amount of energy consumed continuously while the ability is active

_field_tag_reference_64.name: activation effect#effects triggered when player activates ability

item.Name: Can cancel when using charge up

_field_real_fraction.name: throttle dead zone#stick must be pressed at least this much in any direction to consider non-forward Evade

_field_real.name: evade duration:seconds#the amount of time that elapses from the beginning of the evade to the end

_field_real_fraction.name: evade exit sprint fraction:[0,1]#Player will exit the Evade action at this sprint fraction
evade melee interrupt fraction:[0,1]#Player will be able to interrupt to perform a melee at this fraction through the evade

plugin._field_explanation: Use this curve to define the character's speed over the course of an evade performed while the character is on the ground. The x axis measures time from the beginning of the evade to the end. Y axis is the speed of the character (wu/s) in the evade direction at the given time.
malleable property scale applied to the result of the speed function

_field_custom.name: speed function scalar#scale applied to the result of the speed function

_field_struct.name: speed function scalar#scale applied to the result of the speed function

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base

_field_real.name: forward speed modifier:percentage#used to define additional boost for evading forward (1.0 = normal speed, 2.0 = double speed, etc...)

_field_real_bounds.name: speed modifier values:wu/s#Used to map values onto ground and air speed modifier functions below.

plugin._field_explanation: Use this curve to define a modifier on the 'speed function' above when evading on the ground. The x axis measures the players entry speed in direction of the evade, clamped to the floor/ceiling defined above. Y axis is the percent of 'speed function' to use.

Use this curve to define a speed modifier on the 'speed function' above when evading in the air. The x axis measures the players entry speed in direction of the evade, clamped to the floor/ceiling defined above. Y axis is the percent of 'speed function' to use.

Use this curve to define how the camera moves horizontally while the character is evading left or right. The x axis measures time from the beginning of the evade to the end. Y axis is the distance that the camera is offset horizontally from the center of the pill at the given time.

Use these curves to define how the camera tilts when the character evades left/right. The x axis measures time from the beginning of the evade to the end. Y axis is angle (in degrees) that the camera is tilted in the direction of the evade at the given time

Use these curves to define how the camera tilts when the character evades forward/backward. The x axis measures time from the beginning of the evade to the end. Y axis is angle (in degrees) that the camera is tilted in the direction of the evade at the given time

Use this curve to define how the FOV is modified while the character is evading forward or backward. The x axis measures time from the beginning of the evade to the end. Y axis is the amount (in degrees) that the FOV is modified at the given time. Remember that you want a negative number to shrink the FOV.

Use this curve to define the blend weight of the evade overlay animation over the course of the evade. The x axis measures time from the beginning of the evade to the end. The Y axis measures the blend weight of the overlay animation at the given time.

_field_real.name: maximum vertical impulse:world units/second# applied when evade is triggered while airborne - applied upwards if moving upwards at time activation, downwards if moving downwards at time of activation.
maximum vertical impulse speed threshold:world units/second#Threshold speed used to scale vertical impulse; max impulse is applied at or above this speed.
